explanation: OS_CHECK_PATHNAME: This macro executes before any other code in the function and may contain conditional statements; its definition must be inspected to ensure it does not introduce an invariant controlling expression. OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch: The value assigned to return_code comes from this call; the MISRA check hinges on whether the controlling expression (return_code == OS_SUCCESS) can vary, so the function prototype/implementation and semantics are required. OS_SUCCESS: The constant compared against return_code; its definition/value is needed to verify the comparison is meaningful and not trivially invariant. OS_FileSysCheckVolume_Impl: Assigned to return_code inside the guarded block and affects the function's final return; its behavior/return variability is relevant to determining if any later controlling expressions (or overall function behaviour) are invariant. OS_ObjectIdRelease: Releases the token and may have side effects; include to check for any hidden control-flow side effects that could affect invariance reasoning. OS_LOCK_MODE_REFCOUNT, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, OS_FileSys_FindVirtMountPoint: These constant/identifier arguments passed into OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch could determine its behavior; their definitions are needed to assess whether OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch's return is fixed for the given call. OS_object_token_t: Type of token used by the object-id APIs; its definition may reveal constraints/side-effects relevant when examining the called functions for invariance. int32, bool: Underlying typedefs for return_code and repair — required to assess expression evaluation, conversions and whether comparisons/conditions are type-dependent and could be considered invariant by MISRA evaluation.
